blog.name: cleverjonquil
blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

tags: the stark sisters as rosa and amy ftw
summary:
Arya: These Northern Lords don't wanna listen to you. You're like... smart and articulate.
Sansa: So are you! 
Sansa: Why am I...
body:
Arya: These Northern Lords don’t wanna listen to you. You’re like… smart and articulate.

Sansa: So are you!

summary: How do  you find this "Sansa will raise Jon and Daenerys' bastard"? Like Jon will come back from the war with a bastard child...
question: How do  you find this "Sansa will raise Jon and Daenerys' bastard"? Like Jon will come back from the war with a bastard child and it will be a full circle (Cat's issue). I'm ready to vomit every time I see it. Sansa owns Jon nothing. It was him at the end who usurped her. She had enough, she doesn't deserve this targ shit. I really hope if this special snowflake will be alive at the end, he will be far from the north, winterfell and Sansa as possible.
answer: I’m mostly indifferent to it because I don’t think they’ll be a Targ baby but if there is one, I’m with you 100%. I’m sick of them shitting on Catelyn, I really am and I’m sick of them writing Sansa in a way that makes up for Catelyn’s ‘sins’. Not everything is about Jon.

reblog.comment: I’m mostly indifferent to it because I don’t think they’ll be a Targ baby but if there is one, I’m with you 100%. I’m sick of them shitting on Catelyn, I really am and I’m sick of them writing Sansa in a way that makes up for Catelyn’s ‘sins’. Not everything is about Jon.

summary: A good heart. I have a good heart.
text: A good heart. I have a good heart.

summary: It was eight long days until Lysa Arryn arrived. On five of them it rained, while Sansa sat bored and restless by the fire,...
caption:
It was eight long days until Lysa Arryn arrived. On five of them it rained, while Sansa sat bored and restless by the fire, beside the old blind dog. He was too sick and toothless to walk guard with Bryen anymore, and mostly all he did was sleep, but when she patted him he whined and licked her hand, and after that they were fast friends.

“I wish that you were Lady,” she said

It was eight long days until Lysa Arryn arrived. On five of them it rained, while Sansa sat bored and restless by the fire, beside the old blind dog. He was too sick and toothless to walk guard with Bryen anymore, and mostly all he did was sleep, but when she patted him he whined and licked her hand, and after that they were fast friends.

“I wish that you were Lady,” she said

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

tags: day 3: Quotes or Locations or Colors
title: Colors of the Wind
body:
Written for @jonsansasource Day 3: Quotes or Locations or Colors

In a blur of overwhelming emotions Jon screamed things he meant, but not like Sansa took them. And now she ran away and Jon is desperate to find her before darkness falls.

A modern AU completely based on the colors and atmosphere of a small park in autumn.

“Sansa?” Jon was out of his mind. His heart was racing in his chest. His pulse was rushing. His feet were running even though he had no idea where he was going.

He had been an idiot. He had been an absolute idiot and he knew it. He hoped she would listen when he would attempt to explain her what had been going through his mind, why he had screamed all those things at her he shouldn’t have said, how pushing her away himself was just so much easier than being terrified of her waking up one day and realizing he wasn’t worth her, he wasn’t good enough.

“Sansa?” But he had not wanted her to run away.

The air was freezing cold. The trees were bare. Leafs in a million shades of red covered the pavement. The early night fall started to surprise him, even though it was totally normal at this time of the year, with the winter solstice approaching.

She could freeze out there, getting ill because he had screamed at her. She could slip and fall and breaking something because he had screamed at her. She could get lost or even worse: she could be found by some strange man who shouldn’t be the one finding her, who would harm her. Because he had screamed at her.

“Sansa?”

Robb had always spoken about love as if it was something blissful and sweet. But love had always been easy for Robb. Robb was handsome. Robb was brave. Robb was noble. Robb was intelligent. Maybe Robb had been a little naive, most certainly in love, but he had gotten plenty of it. And he had given even more of it. And never had Robb doubted whether or not he deserved it. Because Robb did. And Robb knew he did.

But Jon? What did he have to offer? He didn’t have a family. He didn’t have a fortune in the bank. He wasn’t even sure if he’d ever find a job that could pay the rent and the other bills. He wasn’t brave. He wasn’t noble. He was particularly smart either.

He was impulsive however. Sometimes even reckless. He was too honest for his own good, saying the right things to the wrong people and the wrong things to the right people. He had screamed at Sansa. He had chased her out of the house.

“Sansa!” He yelled again and eventually he fell down on a bench. Drops of rain started to fall down on his dark black curls and his cheeks heated up because of the cold wind blowing in his face. Or maybe they were heating up because of the salted tears that rolled down.

“I didn’t mean it, Sansa, please.” Jon let out a deep sigh. “Not like that.” He shook his head. “I do think we don’t go together. I do think you should be dating someone else. I do think you don’t belong to me.” He buried his face in his hands, but kept on mumbling. “But not because I don’t want you or don’t love you! I do!” Jon let out a deep sigh. “I love and want you more than anything in the world. And I hate it.”

The silence around him was deafening. No footsteps were running towards him. No high pitched voice screamed his name. No arms were wrapped around his neck. No kisses were planted on his cheeks and lips.

“Because you’ve got the power to destroy me. One day, when you’ll realize that I’m just me and you’re the most amazing woman on earth you’ll destroy me.” Jon whispered. “You’ll leave me. You’ll shatter my heart. You’ll break my soul.” He paused for a moment. “But you know?” He looked up at the moon, at the stars, at the trees, freed from their weight, waving in the wind. “I’ll let you!” He started yelling now. “Because those few moments, those few kisses, those nights….” He licked his lips. “It’s all worth it.”

A warm hand rested on his back. Her hip touched his. He didn’t know how long she sat there already. Strangely enough he had not seen or felt her coming. But at least he had thrown the truth out and it seemed that she had heard it.

“Jon Snow…” Sansa pressed the palm of her hand to his cheek and turned his face so he was forced to look at her. “How many times do I need to kiss you to prove that I’m not going anywhere? How often do I need to hold you tightly until the sun rises in the morning to show that I’m here to stay? Which I love you do you think was a lie?”

Jon stretched out his hand and reached for a strand of bright red hair, twirling it between his fingers and looking at it as if it was the prettiest thing he had had ever seen. “More often than is possible.” Jon tried to avoid her glance, but he was failing hopelessly. “I’m not good enough, Sansa. I’ve never been and I’ll never be.”

“Jon!” Sansa raised her voice and cupped his face before she pressed her lips firmly on his. “You’re better than good enough! You’ve always been and you’ll always be! I don’t know who made you believe you’re less than anyone else, and if I’ll ever see or meet them they won’t survive to tell you again, but they were wrong.” She paused for a moment and one of her hands went through his hair. “I know that if any other girl would have gotten your love, I’d be jealous. You’re emphatic and kind. You’re understanding. You prefer peace over war. You want to save lives instead of destroying them” She shook her head. “You don’t see yourself as a knight in shining armor or a prince on a white horse.” She cocked her head. “Because you are neither of those.”

Jon held his breath, longer than he had ever thought himself capable of.

“You are the king of my kingdom, my love and my heart. I want you to rule all three of them.” She kissed him again and again and again and eventually Jon wrapped his arms around her and pressed her tighter to his chest.

“Only if you’ll be the queen ruling over my court, soul and life.”

Sansa pulled back and smiled. “With pleasure, Jon Snow.” She leaned towards him and her lips almost touched his ear while she whispered. “Good luck with coming up with a better speech than the one I just gave you when you ask me to marry you.”

Jon’s cheeks heated up. And this time not because of the cold or his salted tears.

“Because you’ve got the power to destroy me. One day, when you’ll realize that I’m just me and you’re the most amazing woman on earth you’ll destroy me.” Jon whispered. “You’ll leave me. You’ll shatter my heart. You’ll break my soul.” He paused for a moment. “But you know?” He looked up at the moon, at the stars, at the trees, freed from their weight, waving in the wind. “I’ll let you!” He started yelling now. “Because those few moments, those few kisses, those nights….” He licked his lips. “It’s all worth it.”

A warm hand rested on his back. Her hip touched his. He didn’t know how long she sat there already. Strangely enough he had not seen or felt her coming. But at least he had thrown the truth out and it seemed that she had heard it.

“Jon Snow…” Sansa pressed the palm of her hand to his cheek and turned his face so he was forced to look at her. “How many times do I need to kiss you to prove that I’m not going anywhere? How often do I need to hold you tightly until the sun rises in the morning to show that I’m here to stay? Which I love you do you think was a lie?”

Jon stretched out his hand and reached for a strand of bright red hair, twirling it between his fingers and looking at it as if it was the prettiest thing he had had ever seen. “More often than is possible.” Jon tried to avoid her glance, but he was failing hopelessly. “I’m not good enough, Sansa. I’ve never been and I’ll never be.”

“Jon!” Sansa raised her voice and cupped his face before she pressed her lips firmly on his. “You’re better than good enough! You’ve always been and you’ll always be! I don’t know who made you believe you’re less than anyone else, and if I’ll ever see or meet them they won’t survive to tell you again, but they were wrong.” She paused for a moment and one of her hands went through his hair. “I know that if any other girl would have gotten your love, I’d be jealous. You’re emphatic and kind. You’re understanding. You prefer peace over war. You want to save lives instead of destroying them” She shook her head. “You don’t see yourself as a knight in shining armor or a prince on a white horse.” She cocked her head. “Because you are neither of those.”

Jon held his breath, longer than he had ever thought himself capable of.

“You are the king of my kingdom, my love and my heart. I want you to rule all three of them.” She kissed him again and again and again and eventually Jon wrapped his arms around her and pressed her tighter to his chest.

“Only if you’ll be the queen ruling over my court, soul and life.”

Sansa pulled back and smiled. “With pleasure, Jon Snow.” She leaned towards him and her lips almost touched his ear while she whispered. “Good luck with coming up with a better speech than the one I just gave you when you ask me to marry you.”

Jon’s cheeks heated up. And this time not because of the cold or his salted tears.
trail.content_abstract:
Written for @jonsansasource Day 3: Quotes or Locations or Colors

In a blur of overwhelming emotions Jon screamed things he meant, but not like Sansa took them. And now she ran away and Jon is desperate to find her before darkness falls.

A modern AU completely based on the colors and atmosphere of a small park in autumn.

“Sansa?” Jon was out of his mind. His heart was racing in his chest. His pulse was rushing. His feet were running even though he had no idea where he was going.

He had been an idiot. He had been an absolute idiot and he knew it. He hoped she would listen when he would attempt to explain her what had been going through his mind, why he had screamed all those things at her he shouldn’t have said, how pushing her away himself was just so much easier than being terrified of her waking up one day and realizing he wasn’t worth her, he wasn’t good enough.

“Sansa?” But he had not wanted her to run away.

The air was freezing cold. The trees were bare. Leafs in a million shades of red covered the pavement. The early night fall started to surprise him, even though it was totally normal at this time of the year, with the winter solstice approaching.

She could freeze out there, getting ill because he had screamed at her. She could slip and fall and breaking something because he had screamed at her. She could get lost or even worse: she could be found by some strange man who shouldn’t be the one finding her, who would harm her. Because he had screamed at her.

“Sansa?”

Robb had always spoken about love as if it was something blissful and sweet. But love had always been easy for Robb. Robb was handsome. Robb was brave. Robb was noble. Robb was intelligent. Maybe Robb had been a little naive, most certainly in love, but he had gotten plenty of it. And he had given even more of it. And never had Robb doubted whether or not he deserved it. Because Robb did. And Robb knew he did.

body:
Let’s Acknowledge…

That had Sansa not found Jon at the Wall exactly when she did, Jon would have left the Wall and very likely faced execution like Gared in Bran I / Season 1 Episode 1.

Especially given that Ramsay knew where Sansa was heading and knew Jon had let the free folk through the Wall and already wanted Jon dead for having Stark blood.

tags: remind me how much i love this ship
summary: Aegon/Sansa, where Arya thinks they're sickening(ly sweet)
question: Aegon/Sansa, where Arya thinks they're sickening(ly sweet)
answer:
The betrothal had been announced mere days ago and already Arya couldn’t wait for the wedding. Not her own wedding, gods no, but that between Sansa and the crown prince. King Rhaegar had come to Winterfell in person, bringing his son with him, in order to make the match official. Sansa had cried tears of joy when Father told her, and since the prince arrived, she’d been wandering the castle, always singing under her breath. Once, Arya had even caught her sister with a blanket thrown about her shoulders, an imitation of a maiden’s cloak, as she played at being a bride.

At first Arya didn’t understand how Prince Aegon could want a wife as silly as Sansa. But once she met him and saw what a starry-eyed romantic he was, sending Sansa flowers and poems and stealing her away for dancing and kissing… There could be no man better suited for her sister.

Send me a summary of a fic you wish I’d write

summary: Bringing Harry here was the first step in our plan, but now we need to keep him, and only you can do that. He has a weakness for...
caption:
Bringing Harry here was the first step in our plan, but now we need to keep him, and only you can do that. He has a weakness for a pretty face, and whose face is prettier than yours? Charm him. Entrance him. Bewitch him.“

"I don’t know how,” she said miserably.

“Oh, I think you do,”

summary: Do you think when Sansa inevitably outs Littlefinger as a co-conspirator to Jon Arryn’a and Ned Stark’s death and reveals that...
question: Do you think when Sansa inevitably outs Littlefinger as a co-conspirator to Jon Arryn’a and Ned Stark’s death and reveals that he is behind the War of the Five Kings, the scene may play out similarly to Catelyn apprehending Tyrion? She would appeal to the Vale knights and lords based on her knowledge of heraldry, and actually call a trial for the true mastermind, thus bringing about the Justice Catelyn wanted. Also, do you think that Sansa find out what Littlefinger did to Jeyne Poole?
answer:
That’s definitely a possibility, as the scenario would recall Sansa’s connection to both her parents.

And yes, I think she’ll probably find out what Littlefinger did to Jeyne.

King Rhaegar I has ruled peacefully for thirty-one years, but will the realm descend into chaos because of the politics that are played in the south, or will the threat beyond the wall consume everyone?


out of

summary: HISTORY / BRIEF DESCRIPTION: Sansa, born into one of most noble houses, that being House Stark of Winterfell, was brought up...
caption:
HISTORY / BRIEF DESCRIPTION:

Sansa, born into one of most noble houses, that being House Stark of Winterfell, was brought up according to the ways of women in Westeros. From a young age, she was taught the arts of sewing, music, and so forth, how to be courteous and gentle. Whilst her family did encourage a good level of education also, she never received more the physical sort that her brothers did, nor did she receive the ability to be as politically minded as they were. They would grow up to be rulers of the land, she would grow up to be a Lady, a wife and mother foremost, and unlike her younger sister Arya, she is welcome and willing of this role, not aware yet of the poison that fills the hearts of so many people.

As she grew, she yearned to hear all the romantic tales of Knights and their Ladies, the love songs passed through ages, beauty found in them. She started to always want a life of her own that would be as fairy tale as these, becoming a true romantic at heart. Naive as to the ways of the world, she continues to believe that her life will be so. She tries to play the part well enough, becoming benevolent and courteous in all that she does, striving to be right. Though her father is gone, she wishes to make him proud with the steps that she takes in life. Her family has always been extremely dear to her, and she idealizes her newfound father figure, and older brother especially.

However, she’s impressionable and easily taken in, her traditional values and naivety hardly an aid in the troublesome world that she’s soon to encounter. In the Game of Thrones, you win or you die, and she’s currently merely a pawn in the web of lies, though she’ll grow into a player in her own time.

STATISTICS:

BIRTH YEAR: 284 AC.
MARITAL STATUS: Unmarried
GENDER: Female
MORAL ALIGNMENT:  Lawful Neutral
SUN SIGN: Pisces
POSITIVE TRAITS: Idealistic, benevolent, resilient, courteous, adaptable
NEGATIVE TRAITS: Naive, impressionable, prideful, vengeful, traditional

LINEAGE:

mother:  Catelyn Stark née Tully  
father: Brandon Stark †
siblings: Rodrik, Eyron, Arya, Bran, & Rickon Stark
aunt: Lysa Arryn
uncles: Ned Stark, Benjen Stark, Edmure Tully
maternal cousins:  Jasper & Kyra Arryn
paternal cousins: Aegon Targaryen, Lyna & Rodrik Stark

FACE CLAIM:

Sophie Turner

However, she’s impressionable and easily taken in, her traditional values and naivety hardly an aid in the troublesome world that she’s soon to encounter. In the Game of Thrones, you win or you die, and she’s currently merely a pawn in the web of lies, though she’ll grow into a player in her own time.
